sap.ca.ui.PictureViewer.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 PictureViewer was replacing the Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.
Picture viewer control relying on the TileContainer control

DeprecatedInfo.description:
PictureViewer was replacing the Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer.
Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead.
This control will not be supported anymore.

sap.ca.ui.PictureViewer.description: Picture viewer control relying on the TileContainer control
sap.ca.ui.PictureViewer.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new PictureViewer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getTileScaling tileScaling} : float (default: 0.95)
    • {@link #getRemovable removable} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} (default aggregation) : sap.ca.ui.PictureViewerItem[]
  • Associations
    • Events
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.PictureViewer#event:pictureDeleted pictureDeleted} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.TileContainer#constructor sap.m.TileContainer} can be used as well.

vertical.helpDescription:
Whether vertical scrolling should be possible.

Note that this is off by default because typically a Page is used as fullscreen element which can handle vertical scrolling. If this is not the case and vertical scrolling is required, this flag needs to be set to "true".
Important: it is not supported to have nested controls that both enable scrolling into the same dimension.

Note that this is off by default because typically a Page is used as fullscreen element which can handle vertical scrolling. If this is not the case and vertical scrolling is required, this flag needs to be set to "true".
Important: it is not supported to have nested controls that both enable scrolling into the same dimension.

Note that it should be set to "true" when there are no focusable elements inside or when keyboard interaction requires an additional tab stop on the container.

height.helpDescription:
The height of the ScrollContainer.
By default the height equals the content height. If only horizontal scrolling is used, do not set the height or make sure the height is always larger than the height of the content.

Note that when a percentage is given, for the height to work as expected, the height of the surrounding container must be defined.

sap.ca.ui.GrowingTileContainer.description: A Tile container for the Overview tile with growing capabilities
sap.ca.ui.GrowingTileContainer.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new GrowingTileContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getGrowing growing} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getGrowingThreshold growingThreshold} : int (default: 20)
    • {@link #getGrowingScrollToLoad growingScrollToLoad} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • Associations
      • Events
        In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.ScrollContainer#constructor sap.m.ScrollContainer} can be used as well.

maxCharacters.helpDescription: The expand and collapse feature is set by default and uses 300 characters on mobile devices and 500 characters on desktops as limits. Based on these values, the text of the FeedListItem is collapsed once text reaches these limits. In this case, only the specified number of characters is displayed. By clicking on the text link More, the entire text can be displayed. The text link Less collapses the text. The application is able to set the value to its needs.

sap.ca.ui.ExpansibleFeedListItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ExpansibleFeedListItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getMaxLines maxLines} : int (default: 5)
  • Aggregations
    • Associations
      • Events
        In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.FeedListItem#constructor sap.m.FeedListItem} can be used as well.

sap.ca.ui.OverviewTile.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24.3 This control is not required anymore as per central UX requirements. This control will not be supported anymore.
Display aTile that presents an overview of a customer

DeprecatedInfo.description:
This control is not required anymore as per central UX requirements.
This control will not be supported anymore.

sap.ca.ui.OverviewTile.description: Display aTile that presents an overview of a customer
sap.ca.ui.OverviewTile.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new OverviewTile. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: 'null')
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI (default: 'null')
    • {@link #getContact contact} : string (default: 'null')
    • {@link #getAddress address} : string (default: 'null')
    • {@link #getOpportunities opportunities} : string (default: 'null')
    • {@link #getRating rating} : string (default: 'null')
    • {@link #getLastContact lastContact} : string (default: 'null')
    • {@link #getNextContact nextContact} : string (default: 'null')
    • {@link #getRevenue revenue} : string (default: 'null')
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getContactActive contactActive} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • Associations
      • Events
        • {@link sap.ca.ui.OverviewTile#event:contactPress contactPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Tile#constructor sap.m.Tile} can be used as well.

sap.ca.ui.InPlaceEdit.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new InPlaceEdit. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: sap.ui.core.ValueState.None)
    • {@link #getUndoEnabled undoEnabled} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Associations
    • Events
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.InPlaceEdit#event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ca.ui.charts.LineChart.description: Line Chart for the Fiori Project
sap.ca.ui.charts.LineChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/LineChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getChartTitle chartTitle} : string (default: 'Line Chart')
    • {@link #getDataLabelFormat dataLabelFormat} : any (default: '#0')
    • {@link #getMinTouchSize minTouchSize} : string (default: '48px')
    • {@link #getMinTouchWidth minTouchWidth} : string (default: '48px')
    • {@link #getShowLabel showLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowScrollContext showScrollContext} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getChartDataset chartDataset} : any
    • {@link #getDatasetSettings datasetSettings} : any
    • {@link #getChartDatasetSettings chartDatasetSettings} : any
    • {@link #getDataPath dataPath} : string
    • {@link #getData data} : any
    • {@link #getChartBusinessData chartBusinessData} : any
    • {@link #getUseDelayedResize useDelayedResize} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getVertical vertical} : sap.m.VBox
  • Associations
    • Events
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.LineChart#event:onDetailsSelected onDetailsSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#constructor sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart} can be used as well.

sap.ca.ui.DatePicker.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new DatePicker. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getFirstDayOffset firstDayOffset} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getDateValue dateValue} : string
  • Aggregations
    • Associations
      • Events
        In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.InputBase#constructor sap.m.InputBase} can be used as well.

sap.ca.ui.model.format.DateFormat.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since undefined Deprecated API:Since version 1.28. This control has been made available in sap.ui.core. Please use sap.ui.core.format.DateFormat instead! This control will not be supported anymore.
The DateFormat is a static class for formatting and parsing date and time values according to a set of format options. It uses sap.ui.core.format.DateFormat to format and parse dates, and adds a new style daysAgo for Date instances. With this style:
  • For today: "Today" will be displayed (localized)
  • For yesterday: "1 day ago" will be displayed (localized)
  • Between 2 days and 6 days in the past: "x days ago" will be displayed (localized)
  • In the future or more than 6 days in the past: the date will be formatted with a medium style
The daysAgo style can be formatted in UTC. Supported format options are pattern based on Unicode LDML Date Format notation. If no pattern is specified a default pattern according to the locale settings is used.

  • For today: "Today" will be displayed (localized)
  • For yesterday: "1 day ago" will be displayed (localized)
  • Between 2 days and 6 days in the past: "x days ago" will be displayed (localized)
  • In the future or more than 6 days in the past: the date will be formatted with a medium style
The daysAgo style can be formatted in UTC. Supported format options are pattern based on Unicode LDML Date Format notation. If no pattern is specified a default pattern according to the locale settings is used.

sap.ca.ui.PictureTile.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 PictureTile is used in PictureViewer control and is not meant to be consumed outside of PictureViewer usage. PictureViewer was replacing the sap.m.Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer. Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.
Tile control embedding an image and allowing custom sizing

DeprecatedInfo.description:
PictureTile is used in PictureViewer control and is not meant to be consumed outside of PictureViewer usage.
PictureViewer was replacing the sap.m.Carousel as it wasn't supporting some versions of MS Internet Explorer.
Now, the sap.m.Carousel is fully functional, please use sap.m.Carousel instead. This control will not be supported anymore.

sap.ca.ui.PictureTile.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new PictureTile. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '32px')
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '32px')
  • Aggregations
    • Associations
      • {@link #getTileContent tileContent} : string | sap.ca.ui.PictureViewerItem
    • Events
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.PictureTile#event:pictureDelete pictureDelete} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.CustomTile#constructor sap.m.CustomTile} can be used as well.

sap.ca.ui.charts.HorizontalBarChart.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.
Allows you to create a chart using horizontal bars to represent the data

DeprecatedInfo.description:
Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24.
The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts.
Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead!
This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.

sap.ca.ui.charts.HorizontalBarChart.description: Allows you to create a chart using horizontal bars to represent the data
sap.ca.ui.charts.HorizontalBarChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/HorizontalBarChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getData data} : object
    • {@link #getContainer container} : string (default: 'chart')
    • {@link #getBarHeight barHeight} : int (default: 48)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getScroll scroll} : sap.m.ScrollContainer
    • {@link #getHorizontalBarChart horizontalBarChart} : sap.viz.ui5.Bar
    • {@link #getVerticalArea verticalArea} : sap.m.VBox
  • Associations
    • Events
      In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#constructor sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart} can be used as well.

sap.ca.ui.Notes.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.22 This control has been made available in sap.m. Please use sap.m.FeedInput with sap.m.FeedListItem instead! This control will not be supported anymore.
This control is a List with the ability to render an additional control on top of it to add new notes. The developer is responsible to give the correct template to use to display notes (recommended are either the FeedListItem or the ExpansibleFeedListItem). The developer is also responsible to implement the code to send the notes to the backend system, by responding to the addNote event.

DeprecatedInfo.description:
This control has been made available in sap.m.
Please use sap.m.FeedInput with sap.m.FeedListItem instead!
This control will not be supported anymore.

sap.ca.ui.Notes.description:
This control is a List with the ability to render an additional control on top of it to add new
notes. The developer is responsible to give the correct template to use to display notes (recommended are either
the FeedListItem or the ExpansibleFeedListItem). The developer is also responsible to implement the code to send
the notes to the backend system, by responding to the addNote event.

sap.ca.ui.Notes.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Notes. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowNoteInput showNoteInput} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTextMaxLength textMaxLength} : int (default: 1000)
    • {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder} : string
  • Aggregations
    • Associations
      • Events
        • {@link sap.ca.ui.Notes#event:addNote addNote} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.List#constructor sap.m.List} can be used as well.

verticalScrolling.helpDescription:
Indicates if user can scroll vertically inside dialog when the content is bigger than the content area.
Dialog detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, sap.m.ScrollContainer or sap.m.SplitContainer as direct child added to dialog. If there is, dialog will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false automatically ignoring the existing value of this property.

contentWidth.helpDescription: Preferred width of content in Dialog. This property affects the width of dialog on phone in landscape mode, tablet or desktop, because the dialog has a fixed width on phone in portrait mode. If the preferred width is less than the minimum width of dilaog or more than the available width of the screen, it will be overwritten by the min or max value. The current mininum value of dialog width on tablet is 400px.

beginButton.helpDescription: The button which is rendered to the left side (right side in RTL mode) of the endButton in the footer area inside the dialog. From UI5 version 1.21.1, there's a new aggregation "buttons" created with which more than 2 buttons can be added to the footer area of dialog. If the new "buttons" aggregation is set, any change made to this aggregation has no effect anymore. When runs on the phone, this button (and the endButton together when set) is (are) rendered at the center of the footer area. When runs on the other platforms, this button (and the endButton together when set) is (are) rendered at the right side (left side in RTL mode) of the footer area.

initialFocus.helpDescription: Focus is set to the dialog in the sequence of leftButton and rightButton when available. But if some other control needs to get the focus other than one of those two buttons, set the initialFocus with the control which should be focused on. Setting initialFocus to input controls doesn't open the on screen keyboard on mobile device, this is due to the browser limitation that the on screen keyboard can't be opened with javascript code. The opening of on screen keyboard must be triggered by real user action.
initialFocus.description: Focus is set to the dialog in the sequence of leftButton and rightButton when available. But if some other control needs to get the focus other than one of those two buttons, set the initialFocus with the control which should be focused on. Setting initialFocus to input controls doesn't open the on screen keyboard on mobile device, this is due to the browser limitation that the on screen keyboard can't be opened with javascript code. The opening of on screen keyboard must be triggered by real user action.

leftButton.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.15.1 LeftButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the beginButton instead which is more RTL friendly.
LeftButton is shown at the left edge of the bar in iOS, and at the right side of the bar for the other platforms. Please set this to null if you want to remove the left button from the bar. And the button is only removed from the bar, not destroyed. When showHeader is set to false, this property will be ignored. Setting leftButton will also set the beginButton internally.

DeprecatedInfo.description: LeftButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the beginButton instead which is more RTL friendly.

Deprecated! Since 1.15.1 RightButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the endButton instead which is more RTL friendly.
RightButton is always shown at the right edge of the bar. Please set this to null if you want to remove the right button from the bar. And the button is only removed from the bar, not destroyed. When showHeader is set to false, this property will be ignored. Setting rightButton will also set the endButton internally.

sap.ca.ui.HierarchicalSelectDialog.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new HierarchicalSelectDialog. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • Aggregations
      • {@link #getItems items} (default aggregation) : sap.ca.ui.HierarchicalSelectDialogItem[]
    • Associations
      • Events
        • {@link sap.ca.ui.HierarchicalSelectDialog#event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
        • {@link sap.ca.ui.HierarchicalSelectDialog#event:cancel cancel} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Dialog#constructor sap.m.Dialog} can be used as well.

Deprecated! Since 1.24.3 This control is not required anymore as per central UX requirements. This control will not be supported anymore.

sap.ca.ui.charts.StackedVerticalColumnCh.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.
Stacked Vertical Column Chart wrapper around the viz StackedColumnChart / MultipleStackedColumnChart. To be used in conjunction with the chart toolbar.

DeprecatedInfo.description:
Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24.
The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts.
Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead!
This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.

sap.ca.ui.charts.StackedVerticalColumnCh.description:
Stacked Vertical Column Chart wrapper around the viz StackedColumnChart / MultipleStackedColumnChart.
To be used in conjunction with the chart toolbar.
sap.ca.ui.charts.StackedVerticalColumnCh.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/StackedVerticalColumnChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getType type} : string (default: 'StackedColumn')
    • {@link #getMinTouchSize minTouchSize} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '48px')
    • {@link #getDataLabelFormat dataLabelFormat} : any (default: [["##"]])
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Associations
    • Events
      In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#constructor sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart} can be used as well.

sap.ca.ui.charts.VerticalBarChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/VerticalBarChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getData data} : object
    • {@link #getContainer container} : string (default: 'chart')
    • {@link #getBarWidth barWidth} : int (default: 48)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getScroll scroll} : sap.m.ScrollContainer
    • {@link #getVerticalBarChart verticalBarChart} : sap.viz.ui5.Column
    • {@link #getVerticalArea verticalArea} : sap.m.VBox
  • Associations
    • Events
      In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#constructor sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart} can be used as well.

sap.ca.ui.charts.CombinedChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/CombinedChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getData data} : any
    • {@link #getPrimaryAxis primaryAxis} : any
    • {@link #getSecondAxis secondAxis} : any
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getScrollArea scrollArea} : sap.m.ScrollContainer
  • Associations
    • Events
      In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#constructor sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart} can be used as well.

vertical.helpDescription:
Whether vertical scrolling should be possible.

Note that this is off by default because typically a Page is used as fullscreen element which can handle vertical scrolling. If this is not the case and vertical scrolling is required, this flag needs to be set to "true".
Important: it is not supported to have nested controls that both enable scrolling into the same dimension.

sap.ca.ui.ZoomableScrollContainer.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new ZoomableScrollContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getZoomable zoomable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getInitialScale initialScale} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getMinScale minScale} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getMaxScale maxScale} : float (default: 4)
  • Aggregations

      • Events
        In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.ScrollContainer#constructor sap.m.ScrollContainer} can be used as well.

sap.ca.ui.CustomerContext.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24.3 This control is not required anymore as per central UX requirements. Please use Contextual Filter design instead! This control will not be supported anymore.
This control allows you to open a dialog containing a list of customers for users to pick. The chosen selected customer is persisted using sap.ushell services that shall be fully configured outside of this control. The dialog can be open following two modes: "select" : exiting without choosing a customer is firing the customerSelected event with a null customer before closing the dialog "change" : exiting without choosing a customer is simply closing the dialog When opening the dialog in "select" mode, if a customer has been persisted in a previous session, it will be retrieved and the dialog won't open at all.

DeprecatedInfo.description:
This control is not required anymore as per central UX requirements.
Please use Contextual Filter design instead!
This control will not be supported anymore.

sap.ca.ui.CustomerContext.description:
This control allows you to open a dialog containing a list of customers for users to pick.
The chosen selected customer is persisted using sap.ushell services that shall be fully configured outside of this control.

The dialog can be open following two modes:
"select" : exiting without choosing a customer is firing the customerSelected event with a null customer before closing the dialog
"change" : exiting without choosing a customer is simply closing the dialog

When opening the dialog in "select" mode, if a customer has been persisted in a previous session, it will be retrieved and the dialog won't open at all.
sap.ca.ui.CustomerContext.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new CustomerContext. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getPersonalizationPageName personalizationPageName} : string (default: 'AppCustomerContext')
    • {@link #getShowSalesArea showSalesArea} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getPath path} : string (default: '/Customers')
    • {@link #getCustomerIDProperty customerIDProperty} : string (default: 'CustomerID')
    • {@link #getCustomerNameProperty customerNameProperty} : string (default: 'CustomerName')
    • {@link #getSalesOrganizationNameProperty salesOrganizationNameProperty} : string (default: 'SalesOrganizationName')
    • {@link #getDistributionChannelNameProperty distributionChannelNameProperty} : string (default: 'DistributionChannelName')
    • {@link #getDivisionNameProperty divisionNameProperty} : string (default: 'DivisionName')
    • {@link #getDialogTitle dialogTitle} : string
  • Aggregations
    • Associations
      • Events
        • {@link sap.ca.ui.CustomerContext#event:customerSelected customerSelected} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

Deprecated! Since 1.24 Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.
Chart implementation on top of sap.viz that takes care of common functionality. - Embedding in a scroll container - Common color palette - Minimum bar / dot / blip ... size - Integration with ChartToolbar and ChartPopover

DeprecatedInfo.description:
Sap.ca charts have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24.
The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts.
Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead!

sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart.description:
Chart implementation on top of sap.viz that takes care of common functionality.
- Embedding in a scroll container
- Common color palette
- Minimum bar / dot / blip ... size
- Integration with ChartToolbar and ChartPopover
sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/Chart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '100%')
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '100%')
    • {@link #getDataset dataset} : object
    • {@link #getChartType chartType} : string (default: 'Bar')
    • {@link #getMinShapeSize minShapeSize} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '48px')
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string (default: '')
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string (default: '')
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : string (default: '')
    • {@link #getSecondAxisVisible secondAxisVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowLegend showLegend} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSelectionMode selectionMode} : sap.ca.ui.charts.ChartSelectionMode (default: sap.ca.ui.charts.ChartSelectionMode.Multiple)
    • {@link #getShowHoverBackground showHoverBackground} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowTooltip showTooltip} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowPopover showPopover} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowDataLabel showDataLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getYAxisLabelFormatter yAxisLabelFormatter} : string
    • {@link #getYAxis2LabelFormatter yAxis2LabelFormatter} : string
    • {@link #getXAxisLabelFormatter xAxisLabelFormatter} : string
    • {@link #getXAxis2LabelFormatter xAxis2LabelFormatter} : string
    • {@link #getPlotAreaAxisTooltipFormatter plotAreaAxisTooltipFormatter} : object
    • {@link #getTooltipFormatter tooltipFormatter} : object
    • {@link #getDataLabelFormatter dataLabelFormatter} : object
    • {@link #getPopoverFormatter popoverFormatter} : object
    • {@link #getPopoverGroupFormatter popoverGroupFormatter} : string
    • {@link #getChartSemanticColorFormatter chartSemanticColorFormatter} : object
    • {@link #getInternalVizChart internalVizChart} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getChartPopOver chartPopOver} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getPopoverSubHeader popoverSubHeader} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getPopoverFooter popoverFooter} : sap.ui.core.Control
    • {@link #getAdvancedChartSettings advancedChartSettings} : object
    • {@link #getStackedChartWidthEnhancer stackedChartWidthEnhancer} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getNoData noData} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Aggregations
    • Associations
      • Events
        • {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#event:selectDataPoint selectDataPoint} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

Allows you to display a list of uploaded files. You can also upload a new one, rename or delete them

DeprecatedInfo.description:
This control is available in sap.m in 1.26, as sap.m.UploadCollection.
Please use UploadCollection, as sap.ca.ui.FileUpload will not be supported anymore from 1.26.

sap.ca.ui.FileUpload.description: Allows you to display a list of uploaded files. You can also upload a new one, rename or delete them
sap.ca.ui.FileUpload.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FileUpload. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getUploadUrl uploadUrl} : string
    • {@link #getFileName fileName} : string
    • {@link #getSize size} : string
    • {@link #getUrl url} : string
    • {@link #getUploadedDate uploadedDate} : string
    • {@link #getContributor contributor} : string
    • {@link #getFileExtension fileExtension} : string
    • {@link #getMimeType mimeType} : string
    • {@link #getItems items} : string
    • {@link #getUploadEnabled uploadEnabled} : boolean
    • {@link #getFileId fileId} : string
    • {@link #getXsrfToken xsrfToken} : string
    • {@link #getUseMultipart useMultipart} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAcceptRequestHeader acceptRequestHeader} : string (default: 'application/json')
    • {@link #getEncodeUrl encodeUrl} : string
    • {@link #getRenameEnabled renameEnabled} : boolean
    • {@link #getDeleteEnabled deleteEnabled} : boolean
    • {@link #getMultipleSelectionEnabled multipleSelectionEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowNoData showNoData} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSequentialUploadsEnabled sequentialUploadsEnabled} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowAttachmentsLabel showAttachmentsLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUseEditControls useEditControls} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowAttachmentsLabelInEditMode showAttachmentsLabelInEditMode} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEditMode editMode} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getUploadProgressLabel uploadProgressLabel} : sap.m.Label
    • {@link #getAttachmentNumberLabel attachmentNumberLabel} : sap.m.Label
    • {@link #getToolBar toolBar} : sap.m.Toolbar
  • Associations
    • Events
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.FileUpload#event:deleteFile deleteFile} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.FileUpload#event:renameFile renameFile} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.FileUpload#event:uploadFile uploadFile} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.FileUpload#event:fileUploadFailed fileUploadFailed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.FileUpload#event:beforeUploadFile beforeUploadFile} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.FileUpload#event:saveClicked saveClicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.FileUpload#event:cancelClicked cancelClicked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

Constructor for a new charts/BubbleChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getDataLabelFormat dataLabelFormat} : any
    • {@link #getShowTitle showTitle} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowXAxisLabel showXAxisLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getXAxisFixedRange xAxisFixedRange} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getXAxisMinValue xAxisMinValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getXAxisMaxValue xAxisMaxValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getShowYAxisLabel showYAxisLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getYAxisFixedRange yAxisFixedRange} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getYAxisMinValue yAxisMinValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getYAxisMaxValue yAxisMaxValue} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getMinimumLabelSize minimumLabelSize} : int (default: 60)
    • {@link #getShowSizeLegend showSizeLegend} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getXAxisTitle xAxisTitle} : string
    • {@link #getYAxisTitle yAxisTitle} : string
    • {@link #getShowCustomLabels showCustomLabels} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getLabelProperty labelProperty} : object
    • {@link #getXAxisFormatFunction xAxisFormatFunction} : object
    • {@link #getXAxisFormatString xAxisFormatString} : string
    • {@link #getYAxisFormatFunction yAxisFormatFunction} : object
    • {@link #getYAxisFormatString yAxisFormatString} : string
    • {@link #getAxisTooltipFormatString axisTooltipFormatString} : any
    • {@link #getAxisFormatFunction axisFormatFunction} : object
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Associations
    • Events
      In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#constructor sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart} can be used as well.

sap.ca.ui.charts.ChartToolBar.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 Sap.ca charts and the ChartToolBar have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24. The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts. Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead! This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.
ToolBar used for displaying one chart amongst several and provide additional features: - 2 select boxes for selecting dimensions - fullscreen toggle - personalization icon - showLegend toggle

DeprecatedInfo.description:
Sap.ca charts and the ChartToolBar have been replaced with sap.viz and vizFrame in 1.24.
The UI5 control "sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizFrame" serves as a single point of entry for all the new charts.
Now that 1.24 is available you are asked to use sap.viz charts and the VizFrame instead!
This control will not be supported anymore from 1.24.

sap.ca.ui.charts.ChartToolBar.description:
ToolBar used for displaying one chart amongst several and provide additional features:
- 2 select boxes for selecting dimensions
- fullscreen toggle
- personalization icon
- showLegend toggle

If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowPersonalization showPersonalization} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowFullScreen showFullScreen} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFullScreen fullScreen} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowLegend showLegend} : boolean (default: true)

sap.ca.ui.charts.StackedHorizontalBarCha.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new charts/StackedHorizontalBarChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getType type} : string (default: 'StackedBar')
    • {@link #getMinTouchSize minTouchSize} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '48px')
    • {@link #getDataLabelFormat dataLabelFormat} : any (default: [["##"]])
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
  • Associations
    • Events
      In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart#constructor sap.ca.ui.charts.Chart} can be used as well.

sap.ca.ui.AddPicture.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.26 As per central UX requirements, this control is replaced by sap.m.UploadCollection. Please use the new control if you start developing an application instead of using this AddPicture control.
Enables users to add pictures into a form. Contains PictureItem controls that describe the media. It is designed to be used simultaneously with the PictureViewer control

DeprecatedInfo.description: As per central UX requirements, this control is replaced by sap.m.UploadCollection. Please use the new control if you start developing an application instead of using this AddPicture control.

sap.ca.ui.AddPicture.description:
Enables users to add pictures into a form. Contains PictureItem controls that describe the media.
It is designed to be used simultaneously with the PictureViewer control
sap.ca.ui.AddPicture.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new AddPicture. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. If the name of a setting is ambiguous (e.g. a property has the same name as an event), then the framework assumes property, aggregation, association, event in that order. To override this automatic resolution, one of the prefixes "aggregation:", "association:" or "event:" can be added to the name of the setting (such a prefixed name must be enclosed in single or double quotes). The supported settings are:
  • Properties
    • {@link #getButtonPageType buttonPageType} : string (default: 'Tab')
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMaxPictureNumber maxPictureNumber} : int (default: 10)
    • {@link #getUploadUrl uploadUrl} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: '100%')
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getPictureAlign pictureAlign} : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: sap.ui.core.TextAlign.Left)
    • {@link #getItemSize itemSize} : int (default: 64)
    • {@link #getCompression compression} : string (default: 'low')
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getPictures pictures} : sap.ca.ui.PictureItem[]
  • Associations
    • Events
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.AddPicture#event:show show} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.AddPicture#event:pictureAdded pictureAdded} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.AddPicture#event:maxPictureLimitReached maxPictureLimitReached} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.AddPicture#event:imageUploadFailed imageUploadFailed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
      • {@link sap.ca.ui.AddPicture#event:fileNotSupported fileNotSupported} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ca.ui.HierarchyItem.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.24 This control is deprecated as per central UX requirements. This control will not be supported anymore.
Item that represent a line of the Hierarchy control. The emphasized property should apply to the item that we want to represent in his hierarchy. Optionals item will be hidden if the option is true on the Hierarchy control.

    • {@link #getLevelType levelType} : string
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getIdentifier identifier} : string
